title: Cleanup invalid records in vulnerability_feedback table
description:
## Why are we doing this work?

When working on https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/324893+ I realized that we have records in the `vulnerability_feedback` table for `Vulnerabilities::Finding` records that not longer exist.

```sql
SELECT COUNT(v_f.finding_uuid) 
FROM vulnerability_feedback v_f
LEFT JOIN vulnerability_occurrences v_o
ON v_f.finding_uuid = v_o.uuid::uuid
WHERE v_o.uuid IS NULL AND v_f.finding_uuid IS NOT NULL;
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ count  ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ 106730 ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Implementation plan

* [ ] ~database Create a background migration that removes Feedbacks that don't have a matching `finding_uuid`
* [ ] ~database Create a background migration that removed Feedback that don't have a `finding_uuid` and there's not matching `project_fingerprint`

title: Only call vulnerabilitySeveritiesCount for visible tab
description:
The vulnerability report page is making 2 requests to retrieve the vulnerablitySeveritiesCount. The first call is for the "Development vulnerabilities" tab. The second call is for the "Operational vulnerabilities" tab. Let's remove this latter call (and vice versa) until that tab is actually clicked. This affects all 3 vulnerability report pages: group, project, and instance.

| Request Payload | Request Payload Expanded |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![2022-08-30_at_8.16_PM](/uploads/e2794bc34b25e85051c5dc27220a504a/2022-08-30_at_8.16_PM.png)  | ![2022-08-31_at_5.19_PM](/uploads/eeb3f72f9dc9611952f9d5ca9de489a9/2022-08-31_at_5.19_PM.png) |

## Why this is important

Ensuring we only make a request when needed will improve page performance and decrease our complexity score (which helps prevent bugs like this > https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/372151+)

## Steps to reproduce

1. Go to a vulnerability report page
1. Open the developer tools => Network tab
1. Note two `vulnerablitySeveritiesCount` requests are made

title: Adding with_lock_retries and changed statement_timeout to gitlab:db:truncate_legacy_tables:*
description:
The rake tasks `gitlab:db:truncate_legacy_tables:main` & `gitlab:db:truncate_legacy_tables:ci` will most probably fail on staging/production due to the fact that they inherit the default `statement_timeout` value, which is low (either 10 or 15 seconds)

As part of this issue, we are going to make the rake tasks:
1. Use `with_retries` to try again and again, to acquire the lock on the tables. Because `TRUNCATE` will require a lock on the truncated tables.
2. Set the `statement_timeout` to `0` by default, or some high value we specify using parameters.

Some context: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/-/issues/7511#note_1079782592

title: [GraphQL] Use lazy aggregation for epics healthStatus
description:
When querying health status fields in epics using GraphQL we get an extra `COUNT(*)` query for each epic.

#### How to reproduce

1. Visit an epic with multiple children (e.g: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/plan-stage/frontend-engineers/-/epics/1)
2. Use the Performance bar check for queries in `groupEpics`. 
3. There should be a `SELECT COUNT(*)...` query per child epic.


<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot_2022-08-30_at_14.20.48](/uploads/e1f7e0e3a66b8b7f1dd40561fcea5304/Screenshot_2022-08-30_at_14.20.48.png)

</details>

<details><summary>Query</summary>

```sql
SELECT
    COUNT(*) AS count_all,
    "issues"."health_status" AS issues_health_status
FROM
    "issues"
    INNER JOIN "epic_issues" ON "epic_issues"."issue_id" = "issues"."id"
WHERE
    "epic_issues"."epic_id" IN ( WITH RECURSIVE "base_and_descendants" AS (
(
                SELECT
                    "epics".*
                FROM
                    "epics"
                WHERE
                    "epics"."id" = {ID})
            UNION (
                SELECT
                    "epics".*
                FROM
                    "epics",
                    "base_and_descendants"
                WHERE
                    "epics"."parent_id" = "base_and_descendants"."id"))
            SELECT
                "epics"."id"
            FROM
                "base_and_descendants" AS "epics")
        AND ("issues"."state_id" IN (1))
    AND "issues"."health_status" IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
    "issues"."health_status"
```

</details>


#### Proposed solution

Use `Gitlab::Graphql::Aggregations::Epics::LazyEpicAggregate` to aggregate counts for health status too.

title: Metrics Dictionary failing main builds
description:
Job [#2952067963](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/-/jobs/2952067963) failed for 4b114518dbace40ccf71012423a2c89fc2c88ec4:

The jobs for building the application has been failing for [a couple days in a row](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/-/pipelines).
The error log from the job will probably help locate the issue:
```
"/builds/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/lib/csv_generator.rb:31:in `csv_data': undefined method `keys' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
	from /builds/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/lib/csv_generator.rb:40:in `write_csv'
	from /builds/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/lib/csv_generator.rb:14:in `generate'
	from /builds/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/lib/builder.rb:7:in `build'
	from bin/build:5:in `<main>'
```

Another thing that looks suspicious in the log is this part:
```
"Loading next batch [\"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\", \"\"]"
```
It seems like we're not loading any file paths from the GitLabAPI.

However, please note that the empty file paths kind of logs seems to also be in jobs that end successfully: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/analytics-section/product-intelligence/metric-dictionary/-/jobs/2938583638 [it might be caused by another bug].

## Work-around

To view the current status of a metric, please refer to the in code:
- [metrics definition YAML files](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/tree/master/config/metrics) 
- and under ee [metrics definition YAML files](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/tree/master/ee/config/metrics)

## Affects Product Data

Please be aware that this issue does not affect the validity of product data. However, the metrics reported are stale which means that some newly instrumented metrics may not appear and some deprecated metrics may appear to be erroneously active. Some of the older metrics can also be missing on the page.

title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `extract_mr_diff_deletions`
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96455) on production,
that is currently behind the `extract_mr_diff_deletions` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

* Team: ~"group::source code"
* Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_create_source-code-be`
* Best individual to reach out to: @vyaklushin


## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Projects that had problems with deletion will be processed successfully.


### What might happen if this goes wrong?

Projects scheduled for a deletion are not deleted.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

* https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/6a755f20-2dde-11ed-8656-f5f2137823ba (Production)
* https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/b60139f0-2e92-11ed-b86b-d963a1a6788e (Production successful removal)
* https://nonprod-log.gitlab.net/goto/b636fcc0-2dde-11ed-af31-918941b0065a (Staging)

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

_Consider adding links to check for Sentry errors, Production logs for 5xx, 302s, etc._

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set extract_mr_diff_deletions true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com extract_mr_diff_deletions true`
- If you're using [group-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org,gitlab-com extract_mr_diff_deletions true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> extract_mr_diff_deletions true`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [ ] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [ ] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [ ] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96455) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com. 
- [ ] Ensure that any breaking changes have been announced following the [release post process](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#deprecations-removals-and-breaking-changes) to ensure GitLab customers are aware.
- [ ] Notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [ ] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set extract_mr_diff_deletions <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set extract_mr_diff_deletions <rollout-percentage> --random`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set extract_mr_diff_deletions true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96455) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [ ] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the default-enabling MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Consider cleaning up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel. Otherwise these settings may override the default enabled.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete extract_mr_diff_deletions --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96455) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Set the next milestone to this rollout issue for scheduling [the flag removal](#release-the-feature).
- [ ] (Optional) You can [create a separate issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) for scheduling the steps below to [Release the feature](#release-the-feature).
    - [ ] Set the title to "[Feature flag] Cleanup `extract_mr_diff_deletions`".
    - [ ] Execute the `/copy_metadata <this-rollout-issue-link>` quick action to copy the labels from this rollout issue.
    - [ ] Link this rollout issue as a related issue.
    - [ ] Close this rollout issue.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [ ] Create a merge request to remove `extract_mr_diff_deletions` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [ ] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96455) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete extract_mr_diff_deletions --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set extract_mr_diff_deletions false
```

description:

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96448) on production,
that is currently behind the `use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->


## Owners

* Team: ~"group::source code"
* Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_create_source-code-be`
* Best individual to reach out to: @vyaklushin


## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

We expect to see less 500 errors here.

https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/4a3ddb40-2778-11ed-8656-f5f2137823ba

### When is the feature viable?

<!-- What are the settings we need to configure in order to have this feature viable? -->

<!-- 
Example below:
 
1. Enable service ping collection
   `ApplicationSetting.first.update(usage_ping_enabled: true)`
-->

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

The return refs are incorrect / missing elements.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

* https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/4a3ddb40-2778-11ed-8656-f5f2137823ba

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

_Consider adding links to check for Sentry errors, Production logs for 5xx, 302s, etc._

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [ ] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs true`
- If you're using [group-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org,gitlab-com use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs true`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [ ] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [ ] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [ ] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96448) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com. 
- [ ] Ensure that any breaking changes have been announced following the [release post process](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#deprecations-removals-and-breaking-changes) to ensure GitLab customers are aware.
- [ ] Notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [ ] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs <rollout-percentage> --random`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96448) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [x] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the default-enabling MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Consider cleaning up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel. Otherwise these settings may override the default enabled.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96448) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Set the next milestone to this rollout issue for scheduling [the flag removal](#release-the-feature).
- [ ] (Optional) You can [create a separate issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) for scheduling the steps below to [Release the feature](#release-the-feature).
    - [ ] Set the title to "[Feature flag] Cleanup `use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs`".
    - [ ] Execute the `/copy_metadata <this-rollout-issue-link>` quick action to copy the labels from this rollout issue.
    - [ ] Link this rollout issue as a related issue.
    - [ ] Close this rollout issue.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [ ] Create a merge request to remove `use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [ ] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96448) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set use_gitaly_pagination_for_refs false
```

## Testing

On feature release (ff deletion) please ensure that all `instance-parallel` jobs triggered by `e2e:package-and-test` pass in the MR. Any questions, please reach out to the SET counterpart (@a_mcdonald).

title: Add support for in-config helm values
description:
### Release notes

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/clusters/agent/gitops/helm.html

We shipped [initial Helm-chart support for the agent for Kubernetes in GitLab 15.4](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2022/09/22/gitlab-15-4-released/#deploy-helm-charts-with-the-agent-for-kubernetes). The initial solution required Helm values to be included as part of the Helm charts, leading to large-scale code duplication for our users. 

The current release allows you to specify the Helm values as part of the agent configuration. This way, you can add environment-specific values to the agent configuration file and keep generic values within the Helm chart.

### Problem to solve

It should be possible to set the values for a Helm release directly from the agent configuration file.

### Background

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cluster-integration/gitlab-agent/-/merge_requests/727#note_1078812703.

### Proposal

Support inline value objects, under `values.inline` for a given release. For example:

```yaml
gitops:
  charts:
  - release_name: my-release
    source:
      project:
        id: my-group/my-charts
        path: charts/the-chart
    values:
      - inline:
          tag: v15.5.1
          rbac:
            create: true
```

When `values.inline` is set, this should be deep-merged on top of (overwrite) the values from the chart.

title: Spike: Child epics from a different hierarchy
description:
## Requirements

* From within an epic, paste a URL for an epic in another group that you have access to make it a child.
* We shouldn't worry about searching/autocomplete. There could be performance concerns with this workflow and customer feedback is that this is not their preferred path to create parent/child relationships.
* The epic tree should redact epics,subepics and issues that a user does not have access to.
* In ancestors in the sidebar for epics, the parent/ancestor epic should be redacted if the user does not have access to that epic's group.
* In the roadmap, the epic name should be redacted if the user does not have access to that epic's group. It should be included in the rollups for item count and % complete.


### Permissions

| Action | Permissions |
| ------ | ------ |
| Add a child epic | The user needs `admin_epic` permissions for the parent epic and the child epic. The feature `subepics` should be available for the parent epic's group and the child epic's group. |
| Reorder child epics in the epics tree | same above |
| Remove child epics from the epics tree | same above |
| List child epics | The user needs `read_epic` permissions for the parent epic and the child epic |
| List ancestor epics | same as above |

### Tasks

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373713+
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373700+
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373704+
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373708+
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373709+
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373711+

title: `model.getModeId` error in console when editing a yaml file in Source Editor
description:
When editing a yaml file in the Source Editor, the editor throws the `model.getModeId` js error into the console:

![Screenshot_2022-08-26_at_09.19.01](/uploads/3d2624c08a5a939a336d70f4a160b365/Screenshot_2022-08-26_at_09.19.01.png)

# What's causing the error?

The error comes from the `monaco-yaml` package (we're on version 3.0.0). The `getModeId` method has been renamed to `getLanguageId` in `monaco-editor` version 0.30.0 (we're on 0.30.1). However, this rename has not been reflected in `monaco-yaml` up until version 4.0.0

title: GraphQL query for fetching environment/deployment permissions
description:
## Release notes

We have exposed user permissions for environments and deployments through GraphQL. Now you can fetch information about who has access to do particular actions for an environment via API.

## Problem 

In https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/8433, we're moving to GraphQL for rendering Environment Index/Details page and moving away from the internal Controller API. This issue is to extend the [GraphQL API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/graphql/reference/) to let frontend fetch user permission to a particular environment/deployments.

## Proposal

Add the following fields:

- A boolean field to `EnvironmentType` if the user can stop an environment.
- A boolean field to `EnvironmentType` if the user can delete an environment.

We should use [`expose_permissions`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/api_graphql_styleguide.html#exposing-permissions-for-a-type) according to the GraphQL guideline.

Since the permission check could execute an additional query, we should make sure that it doesn't cause N+1 problem when frontend fetches the permission for multiple environments/deployments. If it's difficult to solve, we should set [Limit maximum field call count](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/api_graphql_styleguide.html#limit-maximum-field-call-count) for now.

title: GraphQL query for fetching nested environments
description:
## Problem 

In https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/8433, we're moving to GraphQL for rendering Environment Index/Details page and moving away from the internal Controller API. This issue is to extend the [GraphQL API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/graphql/reference/) to let frontend fetch folderized environments, something similar to `environments.json` does in [Environment Index page](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/environments).

## Proposal

- Add a new argument `environment_type` to the `EnvironmentsResolver` for fetching environments in a specific folder.
  - This can be used in an expanded folder in Environment Index page.
  - This can be used in Environment Index page in a specific folder e.g. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/environments/folders/review.
- Add a new field `nested_environments` to `ProjectType` for fetching nested environments.
  - Add `NestedEnvironmentsResolver` to find environments with nesting. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/serializers/environment_serializer.rb#L36-39 about the nesting logic.
  - Add `NestedEnvironmentType` with the following fields:
    - `size` ... How many environments exist in the nest.
    - `environment` ... The environment represents the group. `Types::EnvironmentType` should be used.
  - This can be used in Environment Index page e.g. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/environments. See `environments.json` for more information.

A few notes:

- `EnvironmentsFinder` already supports `type` param. We should be able to use it as-is.
- For `environments.json`, we folderize this in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/serializers/environment_serializer.rb#L20.

### Query example

```
{
  project(fullPath: "dosuken-org/deployment-approval-test") {
    nested_environments(state: AVAILABLE, search: "") {
      nodes {
        size
        environment {
          name
          environment_type
          last_deployment {
            ...
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Concerns

- `nested_environments` could be an expensive process due to the complex grouping query. Given that we're reusing the existing logic, it might be fine, however, we should seek a way to simplify the logic.

Clean up attention request related system note metadata
description:
We've removed attention request related backend code, but we have existing `system_note_metadata` with `attention_requested` state.

We don't have to clean these up as it's used for displaying icons.

I haven't removed following lines yet, but I think we could clean up these metadata and the following code.

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/6e2f8d14ff77ad3f540b9b2ae0961b5f59fd9148/app/models/system_note_metadata.rb#L27
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/6e2f8d14ff77ad3f540b9b2ae0961b5f59fd9148/app/helpers/system_note_helper.rb#L45

We could just leave them in place as a legacy metadata and be done with it though.

Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/95446/ and #366442


### Testing
Run the `package and qa` job as a regression test. @jay_mccure

title: Clean up attention_requested state for merge_request_reviewers
description:
We've removed attention request related backend code, but we have existing `merge_request_reviewers` with `attention_requested` state.

We need to clean up `merge_request_reviewers` with state `attention_requested(2)` as they are removed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/95446/diffs#98e65609517849214dba86d1597e907ed4216d40_10_9

I think we'd have to either migrate them to `reviewed` or `unreviewed`. `reviewed` seems more likely, but needs to confirm if that's the right thing to do.

Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/95446/ and #366442

### Testing
Run the `package and qa` job as a regression test. @jay_mccure

title: Clean up attention request related user callout data
description:
We've removed attention request related backend code, but we have existing data in user_callouts which needs to be cleaned up.

We need to remove user_callouts that has 47, 48 as they are removed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/95446/diffs#371ded95bb8d62ab0b27ec66b50218bb6f829b9b_50_50

It seems to be slow to remove without an index so we may need to add a temporary index and remove after the release.

Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/95446/ and #366442

title: MVC: Allow using the Content Editor in issues behind a feature flag
description: Allow using the Content Editor to edit issue descriptions with the fewest amount of code changes. Put this feature behind a feature flag.

title: Add has_unauthorized_child_issues to EpicType on GraphQl
description:
We need to add a new boolean field to indicate whether or not
an epic has child issues not visible to a user.  

We need this to support frontend with https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371125#note_1077444278.    

I do not have a final decision about the field name, but we could call it `hasNotVisibleIssues` or maybe
`hasUnauthorizedChildIssues`.  

To check if the epic has any unauthorized field we would need to check for user authorizations on 
all issues projects from different hierarchies, which means N+1 queries, it could be fine for a single epic
but we should increase the field complexity to prevent performance issues in case it gets fetched
for a collection.

title: Notify GitLab user when PAT is auto-revoked
description:
### Proposal

When using the [Personal Access Token API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/personal_access_tokens.html), revocation happens silently. We should update the flow to send an email notification to users in the event that a token is revoked.

#### Implementation steps

1. Add new Rails [mailer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/tree/master/app/mailers) notifying user of PAT token revocation
2. Add logic triggering mailer during [revocation flows](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/services/personal_access_tokens/revoke_service.rb)
3. Add tests covering mailer triggering behavior
4. Consider adding handling for [additional attribution](#additional-attribution) based on revoking entity

#### Text copy

We could use generic copy initially but to better support https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371658 it would be helpful to include attribution when possible distinguishing "we revoked the token because it was public" from a more generic "the token was revoked" copy.

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371911#note_1078507833

#### Additional attribution

When the Revocation API endpoint(s) receive an additional param, the token is validated. If confirmed, the notification will include additional copy notifying the user the token was auto-revoked.

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371911#note_1079583037 for possible approaches

title: Remove legacy ContainerRepository replication
description:
This issue is a part of "Geo: Move container registry to self-service framework" effort. This is similar to what we always do when we migrate data to a new Geo SSF framework, see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/85219. When we're sure that it works fine we remove the old code.

Apart from the obvious things, we need to pay attention to these things:
- [x]  `mark_synced_atomically` method had to be addressed. We don't use it in SSF.
- [x]  `ee/app/models/geo/container_repository_registry.rb#registry_consistency_worker_enabled?` can be removed.
- [x]  Remove ‚Äú### Remove it after data migration‚Äù labels.
- [x]  `ee/app/workers/geo/container_repository_sync_dispatch_worker.rb`. Can be removed.
- [x]  Remove `load_container_registry_data` method.
- [x]  [container_repositories_max_capacity](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/workers/geo/container_repository_sync_dispatch_worker.rb#L22) parameter has to be removed or modified accordingly. (Created issue https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/372444)
- [x]  `ContainerRepositorySyncDispatchWorker` Can be removed.
- [x]  `Geo::ContainerRepositoryReplicator is enabled` in `ee/spec/helpers/ee/geo_helper_spec.rb` can be removed.
- [x]  Update `ee/spec/models/container_registry/event_spec.rb` is not needed anymore
- [x] `Geo::ContainerRepositoryUpdatedEvent` related stuff.
- [x] Address https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/100750#note_1135401703

epic.title: Geo: Move container registry to self-service framework

title: DORA + Insights: handle missing data points
description:
The current DORA implementation only returns data points when measurements were actually taken. This can cause surprising data rendering, especially when we expose the data daily.

Example:

- 2022-05-03 -> 4
- 2022-05-04 -> 6
- 2022-05-06 -> 7

The chart will render the days 04 and 06 exactly next to each other, skipping the 05.

![image](/uploads/98932b8a55a3337ee0c45c5d20672a63/image.png)

![image](/uploads/c02ab096765ff822d514ee7d7bd849c4/image.png)

## Proposal 

~Should we add 05 with "empty" value?~

* Modify the API to return `null` when there is no data for a given date
* Reuse the logic / design from CI CD Analytics to implement a striped line for the null series 

![Screenshot_2022-08-25_at_21.34.59](/uploads/64e1ec5d73663fde28dae14635f8eea8/Screenshot_2022-08-25_at_21.34.59.png)

title: Create Group Usage Quotas view in Core
description:
# Summary

In order to have the Usage Quotas page available for Community Edition we need to:

1. Have a controller in `/app` directory

title: [Feature flag] Enable mass-update legacy SlackIntegration records with bot token
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/361732) on production,
that is currently behind the `update_legacy_slack_installations` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::integrations" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_ecosystem_integrations`
- Best individual to reach out to: @.luke
- PM: @g.hickman 

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Users will only need to re-install the Slack app once for their workspace to have all of their Slack integrations work with the bot token.

### When is the feature viable?

Immediately.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

Errors during the reinstall that prevent it from working.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

Sentry errors https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/?query=is%3Aunresolved+SlackApplicationInstallService

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set update_legacy_slack_installations true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com update_legacy_slack_installations true`
- If you're using [group-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org,gitlab-com update_legacy_slack_installations true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> update_legacy_slack_installations true`
- [x] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [x] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/361732) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com. 
- [x] Ensure that any breaking changes have been announced following the [release post process](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#deprecations-removals-and-breaking-changes) to ensure GitLab customers are aware.
- [x] Notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [x] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set update_legacy_slack_installations <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set update_legacy_slack_installations <rollout-percentage> --random`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set update_legacy_slack_installations true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/361732) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).



### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `update_legacy_slack_installations` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/361732) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [x] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete update_legacy_slack_installations --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set update_legacy_slack_installations false
```

### Availability & Testing

Suggestions: 
* Roll out first on staging, and monitor staging test results in Slack
* After rolling out on production, monitor production test results in Slack

title: RPM initial upload and package creation
description:
## Proposal

When a user uploads an RPM package to `POST api/v4/project/<project_id>/packages/rpm/<filename>`:

1. Parse the `filename` to extract the `name`, `version`, `architecture`, and `release` per the format: `<name>-<version>-<release>.<architecture>.rpm`

1. Find the package based on those params. If none exists, create a new one using a service `Packages::Rpm::CreatePackageService` that also stores the `release` and `architecture` in the `packages_rpm_metadata` table. 

1. We should validate that the file is within the `plan_limit` `rpm_max_file_size` and that the file format is one of `.rpm/.src.rpm/.drpm`.

title: RPM Metadata models
description:
## Proposal

To add support for [RPM packages](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5128) we need to add RPM as a new package format to our models and create a new model and table to store RPM-specific fields.

1. Add `rpm` to the [package_type enum in the Package model](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/aad945911a1fcb39cf3a180713a185c833a1a579/app/models/packages/package.rb#L13-26). 
  1. Adding a package to this file will also require creating a new `plan_limits` column: `rpm_max_file_size`. See [this migration for reference](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/dd1e70d3676891025534dc4a1e89ca9383178fe7/db/migrate/20210319071214_add_helm_max_file_size_to_plan_limits.rb#L7). We should set the limit to `5.gigabytes` based on [this RPM doc](https://rpm.org/wiki/Releases/4.5.90#:~:text=RPM%20now%20supports%20packages%20up,(doubled%20from%20previous%20limit).) that states the limit is currently 4GB. 
1. Create a new table `packages_rpm_metadata` to store metadata for specific packages. This table should include:

Columns | Type | Required | Default | Null?
------- | ---- | -------- | ------- | -----
`package_id` (foreign key to `packages_packages`)| bigint | true |  | false
`release` | text (128) | true | ‚Äò1‚Äô | false
`summary` | text (1000) | true | '' | false
`description` | text (5000) | true | '' | false
`arch` | text(255) | true | '' | false
`license` | text(1000) | false | NULL | true
`url` | text(1000) | false | NULL | true

4. Create the matching model `Packages::Rpm::Metadatum` with validation matching some of the validation included in the database (presence, not null, etc...).

title: Starring or un-starring a project does not refresh its star count in the home page.
description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Land on gitlab.com
- Pick the first project in the list, notice its star count, open the project's page, and star that project.
- Go back to gitlab.com and refresh the page.
- You will notice that the star count hasn't been increased by 1.

Expected output: Star count should have increased by 1 after the refresh.

Root cause:

With https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/95162/diffs, we are not updating the `updated_at` of the `project` record anymore when it is starred.

And our page is fragment cached [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/dff1405e6801db314fdec3cc76dcfd534cf51db6/app/views/shared/projects/_project.html.haml#L22), with the [cache key](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/dff1405e6801db314fdec3cc76dcfd534cf51db6/app/views/shared/projects/_project.html.haml#L13) only containing `updated_at` of the project as one of its keys.

However, since we have stopped updating the `updated_at` of the project on starring/un-starring, this cache doesn't bust anymore, and hence the count appears stale.

Possible solutions:

- Include `project.start_count` into the cache key's definition.

Note: Fragment caching is disabled by default in development. To reproduce this issue in development, we will have to run `rails dev:cache` on the console before attempting to reproduce the issue.

title: Use Crystalball mapping in the `rspec foss-impact` job
description:
Spinned off https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371710#note_1075889990.

## Summary

I just discovered by debugging locally that `RSPEC_TESTS_MAPPING_ENABLED` isn't set for `detect-tests as-if-foss`! :scream: That means we don't use the Crystalball mapping for this job! I can indeed reproduce this locally.

You can see that many RSpec test files are missing from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/jobs/2924374937 compared to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/jobs/2924374936 (excluding the `ee/spec` obviously).

## Expected impact

As a result, this should reduce the number of ~"master:foss-broken", and potentially also reduce the TtFF as `rspec foss-impact` would actually run more tests and be more likely to fail (instead of failing later in FOSS `master`).

title: When viewing a source file on smaller screen sizes long lines wrap, causing misaligned line numbers

title: Web IDE no longer highlighting changes in MRs
description:
### Summary When viewing a MR in the Web IDE changes are no longer highlighted. Customer noted upon upgrade to 15.3.1 on their self hosted instance and I can replicate on gitlab.com I've tested this in FF/Chrome/Safari on gitlab.com (Safari/chrome with a clear cache) and the issue presents. This does **not** seem to occur on my personal aarch64 15.3.1 instance from quick testing ### Steps to reproduce 1. Head to any MR on a project 2. Click the `Code` drop down and click on `Open in Web IDE` ### Example Project Quick sample MR here https://gitlab.com/gitlab-gold/simonstreet-test/webidemrdiff/-/merge_requests/1 ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Changes are not highlighted in the Web IDE side by side diff view for MRs ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Changes should be highlighted ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots Screenshot from above project showing lack of highlights: ![Screenshot_2022-08-24_at_13.54.32](/uploads/1403eed02acbbd871f40599bd531360b/Screenshot_2022-08-24_at_13.54.32.png) ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes

description:
## Summary

The new GraphQL-only component for rendering both vulnerability and pipeline findings needs to be able to render the _existing_ GraphQL schema for a `PipelineSecurityReportFinding` (see https://gitlab.com/-/graphql-explorer for details on the schema):

* [x] identifiers
* [x] links

title: Extend collapsed indicator in MR diff to make the hidden lines more obvious
description:
<!-- This issue template can be used as a great starting point for feature requests. The section "Release notes" can be used as a summary of the feature and is also required if you want to have your release post blog MR auto generated using the release post item generator:  https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#release-post-item-generator. The remaining sections are the backbone for every feature in GitLab.

The goal of this template is brevity for quick/smaller iterations. For a more thorough list of considerations for larger features or feature sets, you can leverage the detailed [feature proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/.gitlab/issue_templates/Feature%20proposal%20-%20detailed.md). -->

### Release notes

<!-- What is the problem and solution you're proposing? This content sets the overall vision for the feature and serves as the release notes that will populate in various places, including the [release post blog](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/categories/releases/) and [Gitlab project releases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/releases). " -->

### Problem to solve

Make collapsed code in an MR diff more visible.

Currently, there are arrows on the gutter indicating that the lines are collapsed. However, on the text side, it is not as obvious.

![Screenshot_2022-08-24_at_4.01.31_PM](/uploads/e7dde1c13cebc730383cfd97e04f4bcb/Screenshot_2022-08-24_at_4.01.31_PM.png)

At quick glance, this looks like the following:
```rb
    def collect_terraform_reports!(terraform_reports)
      each_report(::Ci::JobArtifact.file_types_for_report(:terraform)) do |file_type, blob, report_artifact|
        ::Gitlab::Ci::Parsers.fabricate!(file_type).parse!(blob, terraform_reports, artifact: report_artifact)
      end

      terraform_reports

      job_artifacts.map(&:file_type)
    end
```

In reality, there are hidden lines in between.



### Proposal

Add borders on top of and bottom of unchanged lines section (check design for details)

### Testing

Ensure `gitlab/spec/features/merge_request/user_expands_diff_spec.rb` is passing. May need additional test/assert at this level to check for border separator.

title: Pipeline with non-archive type job artifacts would not unlock earlier pipelines when it is completed
description:
### Problem

`Ci::PipelineSuccessUnlockArtifactsWorker` is supposed to unlock job artifacts from pipelines from earlier commits on the same `ref`.

However, there is a guard clause in the worker that could make it skip the process https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/workers/ci/pipeline_success_unlock_artifacts_worker.rb#L4-4: 

```rb
    def perform(pipeline_id)
      ::Ci::Pipeline.find_by_id(pipeline_id).try do |pipeline|
        break unless pipeline.has_archive_artifacts?
```

So if the pipeline has report type artifacts (e.g test report, security reports, etc), but not "archive" artifact, the artifacts from earlier pipelines would not be unlocked. This could happen given the following config:

```yml
test:
  script:
    - do_test
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: rspec.xml

    # note there is no `paths:`
```

On the other hand, a similar pipeline with an archive artifact defined as follows would have all the artifacts from earlier pipelines unlocked:

```yml
test:
  script:
    - do_test
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - rspec.xml
    reports:
      junit: rspec.xml
```

If the suspected behaviour indeed happens, we have an inconsistent behaviour where non-archive job artifact types may never be unlocked. Consequently, these job artifacts will never be erased after the `expire_at` date.

### What needs to be done?

- [x] Verify if this is indeed the case for pipeline that has no archive type job artifacts
- [x] Decide if this guard clause should be removed
- [ ] Fix the code

### Proposal

Replace the guard clause in [`Ci::PipelineSuccessUnlockWorker`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/workers/ci/pipeline_success_unlock_artifacts_worker.rb#L16-16) to check if the pipeline (i.e latest successful pipeline) has erasable artifacts.

This will have 2 possible effects:
1. If the latest successful pipeline has erasable artifacts, it will unlock all the job artifacts of the previous pipelines
1. If the latest successful pipeline does not have erasable artifacts, it will not unlock the previous pipeline's job artifacts.

Acceptance criteria:
1. Given a new pipeline that only has a report artifact (not archive) and one previous pipeline that have locked report job artifacts, when the new pipeline succeeds, the **previous pipeline's job artifacts are unlocked**.
1. Given a new pipeline that only has a report artifact (not archive) and _multiple_ previous pipelines that have locked report job artifacts, when the new pipeline succeeds, **all the previous pipelines' job artifacts are unlocked**.
1. Given a new pipeline that does not have any job artifact and one previous pipeline that have locked report job artifacts, when the new pipeline succeeds, the **previous pipeline's job artifacts remain unlocked**.

Caveats:

- Given a new pipeline that does not have any job artifact and _multiple_ previous pipeline that have locked report job artifacts, when the new pipeline succeeds, the **previous pipeline's job artifacts will remain locked**. This is expected because we only unlock if the latest succeesful pipelines have job artifacts. In order to unlock these pipelines, a new pipeline with a job artifact needs to be created, which will result in acceptance criteria 2.

title: [Feature flag] Enable Slack App Home
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363635) on production,
that is currently behind the `slack_events_app_home_opened` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::integrations" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_ecosystem_integrations`
- Best individual to reach out to: `@.luke`
- PM: `@g.hickman`

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Unfortunately we can't actually test this on SaaS before enabling, as to test it requires our GitLab Slack App to be republished to the Slack app directory, and once that happens the feature is live for everyone. Instead, we'll need to QA on staging and then enable on production.

### When is the feature viable?

Immediately.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

The API endpoint `/api/v4/integrations/slack/events` might error. This endpoint is only used by the Slack Events API.

The GitLab Slack App's Home tab will not display our intended view, although the customer will not see any errors. Just a place-holder view provided by Slack.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

Sentry for errors.

Kibana to see the worker.

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

Sentry for errors.

Kibana to see the worker.

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set slack_events_app_home_opened true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

The feature flag does not take an actor so there is no rollout.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [x] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363635) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com. 
- [x] Ensure that any breaking changes have been announced following the [release post process](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#deprecations-removals-and-breaking-changes) to ensure GitLab customers are aware.
- [x] Notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [x] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set slack_events_app_home_opened <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set slack_events_app_home_opened <rollout-percentage> --random`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set slack_events_app_home_opened true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363635) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).



### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `slack_events_app_home_opened` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363635) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [x] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete slack_events_app_home_opened --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set slack_events_app_home_opened false
```

title: Move Slack Events API code to EE
description:
### About

The Slack Events API was added in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/86323 to FOSS. 

We need to move the code to EE. 

The Slack Events API only works with the GitLab Slack App, which is currently SaaS only. 

The GitLab Slack App is used with the [GitLab Slack Application integration](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/gitlab_slack_application.html), and the models for this (`Integrations::GitlabSlackApplication` and `SlackInstallation`) are only in EE. 

The reason the models are in EE is because of the current limitation of the GitLab Slack App only working for SaaS.

In the near future, we plan to make it available to all self-managed customers, at which point the code will be moved to FOSS. 

In the meantime, while building on the Slack Events API for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/363635, it was discovered that due to some of the models being EE-only, it's impossible to continue to write passing tests for the feature while the API is in FOSS.

title: Vulnerability Report: Change `Manually Added` to `Manually added` in Tool dropdown
description:
### Problem to solve

We currently use `Manually Added` (capital `A`) in the Tool dropdown on the Vulnerability Report. According to our [docs style guide](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/styleguide/#capitalization), we trend towards lowercase and sentence case. Our tech writer, @claytoncornell [has approved this proposal change](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/299552/designs/Final.png#note_1075005621).

### Solution

Change `Manually Added` to `Manually added`.
